did.unittitle: A Guide to the Jeff Trollinger Papers: Records of the Sexual Minorities Commission and Other Voices Chorus, 1990-2005

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Do not serve membership files of Sexual Minorities Commission or Other Voices located in box 1, folders 3 and 16.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A Guide to the Jeff Trollinger Papers of the Sexual Minorities Commission and Other Voices Chorus, 1990-2005, Collection Number M 359, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University, Richmond, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in August of 2005 by Mr. Jeff Trollinger.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Virginia Commonwealth University does have a signed Deed of Gift transferring literary property rights.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was created as part of the Archives of the New Dominion project funded by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Jeff Trollinger is a member of the pastoral care team of St. Michael Catholic Church in Glen Allen, Virginia. Trollinger represents the We are Family portion of the team, which focuses on ministry to Gay and Lesbian Catholics, their families and their friends. He was the vice chair of the Sexual Minorities Commission of the Catholic Church for the years 2000-2002 and the chair of the commission from 2002 until 2004, during which time he collected current events in papers and magazines dealing with gay rights concerns and gay representation in religion. The Commission on Sexual Minorities was the first attempt by a Catholic diocese to reach out to homosexual parishioners when it was established in 1977 in Richmond, Virginia by Bishop Walter Sullivan. While it was not instantly accepted by many in the church, there were more than forty commissions like it twenty years later. It was disbanded in 2004 when Bishop Francis DiLorenzo was appointed to Richmond.
Jeff Trollinger was also a member of Other Voices: The Richmond Lesbian and Gay Chorus, and was made president of the steering committee in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Jeff Trollinger Papers consist of information from the Sexual Minorities Commission including minutes, correspondence, membership files, publications, and a handbook entitled National Association of Catholic Diocesan Lesbian and Gay Ministries (NACDLGM). There is also a large section of papers relating to the Other Voices Chorus. These have minutes, correspondence, membership files, a board member handbook, state incorporation papers, sheet music, and information from the Gay and Lesbian Association (GALA) of Choruses Conference. There is also a videotape. The bulk of the collection consists of original and photocopied scrapbooks kept by Mr. Trollinger that consist of news articles relating to the gay community.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in the collection are in alphabetical order within each series, with the exception of the scrapbooks which are kept in their original order. Photocopies of the scrapbooks are sorted by date.

There are three series in this collection. Series I is the Sexual Minorities Commission, 1975, 1980, 1990-2005, undated. Series II is Other Voices Chorus, 1993-1999, undated. Scrapbooks are series III, dated 1990-2004. Photocopies of the scrapbooks are filed first with originals following. The originals have the complete listing of all headlines.
